stork.feather

Class PassiveTap<R extends Resource<?,R>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.ProxyElement<S,Resource>
      • stork.feather.Tap<R>
        • stork.feather.PassiveTap<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The source Resource type.

    public abstract class PassiveTap<R extends Resource<?,R>>
extends Tap<R>
    PassiveTaps expect to have Resources explicitly requested by some active requestor process. In that sense, PassiveTaps behave somewhat like a traditional data server. An example is an FTP session, where the Tap waits for initialize(...) to be called on each Resource when it is ready to be transferred. Passive Taps must override #initialize(Relative) to implement behavior that starts the transfer of data for the requested Resource.
    See Also:
    Sink, Slice, Transfer

    • Method Detail

      • start

        protected abstract void start(Bell bell)
                       throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ProxyElement
        Prepare to begin the transfer of data. This involves, for example, establishing data channels, pipelining transfer commands, altering state, etc. The Sink will ring bell when data may begin being drained.
        Specified by:
        start in class Tap<R extends Resource<?,R>>
        Parameters:
        bell - a Bell whose ringing indicates the transfer of data may begin.
        Throws:
        Exception - if this transfer element cannot be started for a reason known immediately.
